text: His offering consisted of one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels and one silver basin weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both filled with bran flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
the lampstands of pure gold, five to the right and five to the left before the inner sanctuary; their flowers, lamps, and tongs of gold;
descendants of Hanan, descendants of Giddel, descendants of Gahar,
They decreed that it should be observed every year on the thirteenth of Adar.
The others at table said to themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
But this crowd, which does not know the law, is accursed.”
‘The heavens are my throne, the earth is my footstool. What kind of house can you build for me? says the Lord, or what is to be my resting place?
